name: Babel
description: A compiler for writing next generation JavaScript. Resources: Try it out, Babel CLI

name: Webpack
description: A JS module bundler that takes modules with dependencies and generates static assets representing those modules. Resources: Getting Started, Concepts

name: Ruby/Rails
description: A web-application framework written in Ruby that includes everything needed to create database-backed web applications according to the MVC pattern. Resources: Guides, API

name: Ember.js
description: A framework for creating ambitious web applications. Resources: Quick Start, Ember Guides

name: React.js
description: A declarative, efficient, and flexible front-end library for creating interactive user interfaces. Resources: Tutorial, Quick Start

name: Redux
description: An open-source JavaScript library designed for managing application state primarily used together with React. Resources: Basics, Video tutorials

name: Elixir
description: A functional, concurrent, general-purpose programming language that runs on the Erlang virtual machine (BEAM) and designed for building scalable and maintainable applications. Resources: Getting Started, Koans

name: Immutable.js
description: A JS library that provides many persistent immutable data structures to optimize performance. Resources: Documentation, Use with Redux

name: Phoenix
description: A framework that leverages the Erlang VM and Elixir as tools for building fault-tolerant systems. Resources: Up and Running, Jose Valim Phoenix talk

name: React Native
description: A framework for composing a rich mobile UI from declarative components using React. Resources: Getting Started, API

name: ECMAScript 2017
description: Eighth edition of ECMAScript and best known as the language embedded in web browsers. Resources: Complete Specifications, Feature Set

name: Elm
description: A language that generates JavaScript with great performance and no runtime exceptions. Resources: Guide, Beginning Elm

name: GraphQL
description: A query language for APIs and a runtime executing queries by using a type system you define for your data. Resources: Intro, Basics

name: Docker
description: An open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications. Resources: Get Started, Working with Containers

name: AWS Lambda
description: An event-driven, serverless computing platform in the cloud. Resources: Getting Started, Dev Guides

name: TDD
description: The practice of writing automated tests to drive out the design of your program. Resources: Getting Started, Test-Driven Rails

name: APIs as a product
description: An approach for designing an API as a standalone product even when the consumer is an internal system. Resources: Review, Slides

name: Lightweight Architecture Decision Records
description: An approach for doing "just enough" software design up-front. Resources: Exerices, Interview

name: Reactive architectures
description: Architechtures based on a one-way, asynchronous flow of immutable events through a network of independent processes. Resources: Interview, Reactive Manifesto

name: Serverless architectures
description: Refer to applications that significantly depend on third-party services (knows as Backend as a Service or "BaaS") or on custom code that's run in ephemeral containers (Function as a Service or "FaaS"). Resources: In-depth article, Use cases

name: Postgres
description: An open source object-relational database system known for reliability, data integrity, and correctness. Resources: Tutorial, Try SQL

name: REST APIs
description: Representational State Transfer is an architecture style for designing networked applications that relies on relies on a stateless, client-server, cacheable communications protocol. Resources: Cheat Sheet, Video tutorials

name: BDD
description: A software development process for figuring out what to build that helps flesh out behaviour. Resources: Basics, Rspec and BDD

name: Linting
description: The process of running a program that will analyse code for potential errors. Resources: ESLint, Rubocop

name: OpsWorks
description: A configuration management service for automating deployment and monitoring of AWS servers. Resources: Basics, User Guide

name: Chef
description: A configuration management tool that can help you configure your infrastructure in an automated and repeatable way. Resources: Learn Chef, Tutorials

name: Continuous Integration
description: The process of automating the build and testing of code every time a team member commits changes to version control.Resources: Detailed explanation, Essentials

name: Machine Learning
description: A subfield of AI that aims to understand the structure of data and fit that data into models that can be understood and utilized by people. Resources: Introduction, Step-by-step Tutorial

name: FHIR
description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources defines a standard for describing data formats and elements (known as "resources") and API for exchanging electronic health records. Resources: FHIR wiki, Interoperability

name: HealthKit
description: A framework for sharing health and fitness data with other apps, while maintaining the user’s privacy and control over their data. Resources: Guides, Documentation

name: Smart on FHIR Sandbox
description: A virtual testing environment that mimics a live EHR production environment, but is populated with sample data used to test and demonstrate apps on SMART on FHIR platform. Resources: Tutorials, Sandbox

name: Alexa/voice UI
description: An intelligent personal assistant developed by Amazon. Resources: Intro to Alexa, Build an Alexa skill using Node, Voice Design Guide.

name: Chatbots
description: A computer program which conducts a conversation via auditory or textual methods. Resources: Beginner's guide, BotKit

name: Swift
description: A general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled programming language for iOS and other Apple OS. Resources: Getting Started, Playgrounds

name: Blockchain
description: An open, distributed ledger that can record transactions between two parties efficiently and in a verifiable and permanent way. Resources:Blockchain explained, Blockchain explained again

name: Ember Fastboot
description: Progressive enhancement for ambitious web apps. Resources: Inside Fastboot, Quick Start

name: Glimmer
description: A library for building modern UI components optimized for the mobile web. Resources: Progress Report, Web component example

name: Yarn
description: A fast, reliable and secure Javascript package manager that features a deterministic install algorithm and a lockfile capability. Resources: Getting started, Workflow

name: npm
description: A package manager for JavaScript and the world’s largest software registry. Resources: Get started with npm

name: Twilio
description: Cloud communications platform for building SMS, Voice & Messaging apps. Resources: Quick Tutorials

name: Mocha/Chai
description: Mocha is a feature-rich JavaScript test framework that can be used with Chai, a BDD / TDD assertion library. Resources: Getting Started with Mocha, Chai API)

name: Node.js
description: A platform for building fast and scalable server applications using JavaScript. Uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient. Resources: Node on AWS, API design in Node

name: d3
description: A JavaScript library for producing dynamic, interactive data visualizations that makes use of SVG, HTML5, and CSS standards. Resources: Tutorials,

name: Contentful
description: An API-first CMS that makes it easy for companies to publish editorial content in webapps, mobile apps, and any smart devices. Resources: Contentful.js, Content Model

name: JSON API
description: A specification for how a client should request that resources be fetched or modified, and how a server should respond to those requests. Resources: Implementations, Base Specification

name: Sketch
description: A digital toolkit for designing user interfaces, websites, and icons. Resources: Getting Started, Video Tutorials

name: ElasticSearch
description: A highly scalable open-source full-text search and analytics engine and art of ELK (Elasticsearch/Logstash/Kibana) stack. Logstash is data collection engine for aggregating and parsing data while Kibana a browser based analytics and search dashboard plugin. Resources: Getting Started, Elasticsearch for Rails

name: Redis
description: An in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache and message broker. Resources: Introduction, Try Redis

name: Web sockets
description: Technology for opening an interactive communication session between the user's browser and a server. Resources: Tutorial, Thoughtbot article

name: Solidity
description: JavaScript-like language for implementing smart contracts, designed to target the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). Resources: https://cryptozombies.io/

name: Electron
description: Build cross platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

name: Azure
description: A set of cloud services including integrated tools and DevOps support for building, deploying, and managing applications across a variety of stacks for SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS applications. Resources: Microsoft Azure Documentation

name: Zeplin
description: Collaboration app for UI designers and developers.

name: Vue.js
description: Javascript framework that focuses on building user interfaces. Comparable to React but uses a different set of underlying technologies and tools.
